headline: Migration timing is predictable by region, not by exact date
summary: The Great Migration follows a general annual pattern, but exact locations and timing vary year to year. The herds are generally in southern Serengeti for calving (January-March), central Serengeti (April-May), northern Serengeti and Mara (July-October), and returning south (November-December). River crossings depend on rain and cannot be precisely scheduled.

assumptions.text: The general migration pattern is predictable by season and region.
Exact timing varies by 2-4 weeks depending on rainfall.
River crossing timing cannot be precisely predicted or guaranteed.

gains: Shoulder months: Fewer crowds, still good wildlife
losses: Cannot guarantee seeing specific migration events
Peak migration months have highest prices and crowds
River crossings require luck and patience
Short trips may miss migration if timing is off

change_conditions: If river crossings are the priority, July-October in northern Serengeti or Mara is best.
If calving and predator action appeal, January-March in southern Serengeti.
If dates are fixed, adjust location expectations to where migration likely is.
If flexible, book last-minute to follow current migration reports.
